dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 3060 IH: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 232 Southwest Johnson Avenue in Burleson, Texas, as the “Sergeant William Moody Post Office Building”.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Williams (for himself, Mr. Barton, Mr. Brady of Texas, Mr. Burgess, Mr. Carter, Mr. Conaway, Mr. Culberson, Mr. Farenthold, Mr. Flores, Mr. Gohmert, Ms. Granger, Mr. Hall, Mr. Hensarling, Mr. Sam Johnson of Texas, Mr. Marchant, Mr. McCaul, Mr. Neugebauer, Mr. Olson, Mr. Poe of Texas, Mr. Sessions, Mr. Smith of Texas, Mr. Stockman, Mr. Thornberry, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mr. Castro of Texas, Mr. Cuellar, Mr. Doggett, Mr. Gallego, Mr. Al Green of Texas, Mr. Gene Green of Texas, Mr. Hinojosa, Ms. Jackson Lee, Ms. Eddie Bernice Johnson of Texas, Mr. O’Rourke, Mr. Veasey, and Mr. Vela) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 232 Southwest Johnson Avenue in Burleson, Texas, as the Sergeant William Moody Post Office Building.

section.header: Sergeant William Moody Post Office Building

subsection.text: The facility of the United States Postal Service located at 232 Southwest Johnson Avenue in Burleson, Texas, shall be known and designated as the Sergeant William Moody Post Office Building.

Any reference in a law, map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the facility referred to in subsection (a) shall be deemed to be a reference to the Sergeant William Moody Post Office Building.
